raw_comment:
I noticed that people with the 70th - 90th percentile are below average. The legacy has a boost and is more likely to get in. 

I wonder how this graph would change depending on the year it was taken in. I also wonder why the 75th- 90th percentile is below average and the 10th percentile of income is above. 

There aren't that many very rich people where we live, that are in the 99.5% so I feel like you have to be very educated and intelligent to be able to get into a top school. There aren't that many people who have parents who have went to top schools before either. 

Headline:

Colleges of excellence: Are you a top candidate?

I wonder why the 75th percentile is below average.
I wonder why the 90th percentile is below average.
I wonder why the 10th percentile of income is above average.
In this place, there are not many very rich people.
In this place, there are not many people in the 99.5th percentile.
I feel that a person must be very educated to get into a top school.
I feel that a person must be very intelligent to get into a top school.
In this place, there are not many people whose parents went to top schools before.
The headline is: Colleges of excellence: Are you a top candidate?
